sub_topic: Citric acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation
message_1: What is the net number of ATP molecules produced per glucose molecule oxidized in the citric acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation?
message_2:
The net number of ATP molecules produced per glucose molecule oxidized in the citric acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation is approximately 36-38 ATP. This includes:

1. Glycolysis: 2 ATP (net) and 2 NADH (which can generate 4-6 ATP in oxidative phosphorylation, depending on the shuttle system used to transport electrons into the mitochondria)
2. Pyruvate decarboxylation: 2 NADH (generating 6 ATP in oxidative phosphorylation)
3. Citric acid cycle: 2 ATP, 6 NADH (generating 18 ATP in oxidative phosphorylation), and 2 FADH2 (generating 4 ATP in oxidative phosphorylation)

The total ATP yield is approximately 36-38 ATP per glucose molecule, depending on the efficiency of the electron transport chain and the shuttle system used for NADH transport.
